page.title: 20We Move To A Village
page.content: Two years ago my family moved from a lively suburb of Chester to the country village of Coddington. The children in my family are aged 17,16,13,10 and 7. After two years in the country we older three still prefer town living. The main differences are that in Chester we had a regular Youth club and frequent bus service, whilst here there is nothing to do and no evening buses. The younger ones enjoy living in the country, as there is more freedom and closeness to nature. My father continues his milk round in Chester although it means a lot of travelling and rising at 2.30am each day. My mother joins in village life attending church and Womens Institute. I am now staying on at school after 16 to gain more qualifications to try to get a job when I leave school.
